title: Five Andhra Pradesh Artisans Honoured at National Handicrafts Awards for 2023 & 2024
excerpt: Five talented artisans from Andhra Pradesh have been honored with the prestigious National Handicrafts Awards, recognizing their exceptional contribution to preserving traditional crafts.
content:
New Delhi | 9 December 2025

On the occasion of National Handicrafts Week (8–14 December), the Ministry of Textiles, Government of India, organised the National Handicrafts Awards for the years 2023 and 2024 at New Delhi on 9 December 2025. The prestigious awards were presented by the Hon'ble President of India, Smt. Droupadi Murmu, to outstanding artisans from across the country in recognition of their exceptional contribution to India's rich craft heritage.

The awardees were conferred under several distinguished categories, including the Shilp Guru Award, Design Innovation Award, National Awardee Category, Women Award Category, Special Mention, and Miscellaneous Category. The grand ceremony witnessed the participation of eminent craftsmen and artisans representing all States and Union Territories of India.

Pride of Andhra Pradesh

It is a matter of immense pride that five artisans from Andhra Pradesh have brought national recognition to the State by securing these prestigious honours: two awards for 2023, one award for 2024, and two Special Mention Awards for 2024.

List of Awardees:

  • Smt. D. Sivamma – Shilp Guru Award 2023 (Women Category) for her exceptional mastery in Leather Puppetry Craft, including the famed Sri Krishna Charitha.
  • Smt. P. Vijaya Lakshmi – National Handicrafts Award 2023 (Women Category) for excellence in Kalamkari Hand Painting.
  • Sri Gorsa Santosh – National Award 2024 for his outstanding contribution to Etikoppaka Toys, a traditional GI-tagged craft of Andhra Pradesh.
  • Sri Kanday Anjanappa – Special Mention Award 2024 for Leather Puppetry Craft.
  • Sri Khande Harinath – Special Mention Award 2024 for Leather Puppetry Craft.

The achievements of these distinguished artisans stand as a shining testimony to the rich cultural heritage, traditional craftsmanship, and artistic excellence of Andhra Pradesh. These honours also reflect the continued commitment of the State Government towards strengthening the handicrafts sector through policy support, skill training, marketing assistance, and comprehensive welfare measures for artisans.

The awardees have expressed their heartfelt gratitude to the Hon'ble Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh, Shri Nara Chandrababu Naidu Garu, and Lepakshi handicrafts for his constant encouragement, institutional backing, and for creating a supportive ecosystem that has significantly contributed to their national recognition and success.

title: A New Chapter Begins: Launch of Banantra & Hyaloom product at CII, Vizag 2025
excerpt: Lepakshi Handicrafts unveils innovative eco-friendly product lines Banantra and Hyaloom at the CII conference in Vizag.
content:
Lepakshi Handicrafts marked a significant milestone with the grand launch of its two premium brands, Banantra and Hyaloom, at the prestigious CII Partnership Summit, Visakhapatnam 2025. The brands were officially launched by Smt. S. Savitha, Hon'ble Minister, in the esteemed presence of Ms Suchitra Ella, Advisor, APHDC, along with Vishwa. M, VC & MD, Lepakshi Handicrafts, senior government officials, industry leaders, and global delegates.

Speaking at the launch, Hon'ble Minister S. Savitha highlighted the importance of the handicrafts sector in rural employment, women's empowerment, and sustainable economic growth. She commended Lepakshi Handicrafts for their continued efforts in modernising traditional crafts through branding and innovation.

Ms Suchitra Ella, Advisor, APHDC, emphasised the role of design-led development, global partnerships, and market-driven strategies in positioning Andhra Pradesh as a hub for sustainable lifestyle products.

About the Brands:

Banantra is a sustainability-led brand focused on eco-friendly products crafted from natural banana fibre, promoting green alternatives and the circular economy.

Hyaloom is a premium handloom and lifestyle brand that celebrates the rich weaving heritage of Andhra Pradesh, blending traditional craftsmanship with contemporary design.

The launch reflects Andhra Pradesh's growing emphasis on sustainability, innovation, and global branding of indigenous products. With the introduction of Banantra and Hyaloom, Lepakshi Handicrafts reaffirms its commitment to:

  • Sustainable development
  • Artisan-centric growth
  • Innovation rooted in tradition
  • Global brand positioning

These brands are set to elevate Andhra Pradesh's craft heritage to new global platforms.

title: Handicrafts Exhibition & Competition at Amma Kalyana Mandapam, Vijayawada, Andhra Pradesh, from 8th Sep to 14th Sep 2025
excerpt: Annual handicrafts exhibition featuring master artisans from across Andhra Pradesh, showcasing traditional and contemporary crafts.
content:
The Development Commissioner (Handicrafts), Ministry of Textiles, Government of India, in collaboration with the Andhra Pradesh Handicrafts Development Corporation Ltd. (APHDCL), organised the Gandhi Shilp Bazaar Exhibition-cum-Sale from 8–14 September 2025. The event was inaugurated by Dr. Pasupuleti Hari Prasad, Chairman of APHDCL, along with senior state officials.

The exhibition featured over 40 stalls and a special display of masterpieces, showcasing the artistic traditions of Andhra Pradesh and other regions. Products included hand-woven textiles, Kalamkari work, wood carvings, leather puppetry, Kondapalli and Etikoppaka toys, decorative artefacts, and other handmade creations. The bazaar provided a platform for artisans to connect directly with customers, enhance livelihoods, and promote India's diverse handicraft heritage.

A key highlight was the first-ever Handicrafts Design Competition, which drew 86 artisans across five crafts—Etikoppaka toys (15), Kondapalli toys (17), Kalamkari (13), Leather Puppetry (25), and Wood Carving (16). Their work was assessed by a jury of five experts on innovation, craftsmanship, design, and market potential. Winners received Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals with cash awards totalling ₹3 lakhs.

The event successfully combined cultural preservation with contemporary relevance, fostering innovation while honouring traditional skills and strengthening appreciation for India's rich craft heritage.

title: Craft Bazaar at Gohar Mahal, Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh, from 16th June to 25th June 2023
excerpt: Lepakshi Handicrafts participates in the prestigious Gohar Mahal Craft Bazaar, showcasing exquisite handcrafted products.
content: Department of Handlooms and Textiles, Government of Andhra Pradesh, and Department of Cottage and Rural Industries, Government of Madhya Pradesh, organized Craft Bazaar at Gohar Mahal, Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh, from 16th June to 25th June 2023. The event was inaugurated by Smt. K. Sunitha Garu, IAS, Principal Secretary to the Government, Industries and Commerce (Handlooms & Textiles), Govt. of Andhra Pradesh and Sri. Manu Srivastava Garu, IAS, Additional Chief Secretary of Cottage and Rural Industries Department, Madhya Pradesh, along with Smt. Sufiyah Faruqui Garu, IAS, Commissioner and Managing Director of Sant Ravidas MP Handicrafts and Handloom Development Corporation and Sri. Vishwa.M Executive Director of APHDCL. The Craft Bazaar featured over 14 stalls, showcasing the impressive craftsmanship and cultural diversity of Andhra Pradesh. Visitors could find a wide range of handmade products, including hand-printed textiles, Kalamkari paintings, hand-woven textiles, leather puppets, toys from Etikopakka, dress material, and more. The execution of the craft bazaar was done by Mrignaynee, Lepakshi Handicrafts and APCO. The exhibition provided an excellent platform for artisans and craftsmen to showcase their skills and talents and helped promote and preserve the rich cultural heritage of Andhra Pradesh.

title: Craft Bazaar at the Siddhartha College Ground in Vijayawada from February 17th to February 26th, 2023
excerpt: Ten-day craft bazaar featuring artisans from across the state, offering handloom textiles, pottery, and traditional crafts.
content:
The Andhra Pradesh Handicrafts Development Corporation Limited is currently holding a Craft Bazaar at the Siddhartha College Ground in Vijayawada from February 17th to February 26th, 2023. The event was inaugurated on February 17th by esteemed guests including Sri S. Dilli Rao Garu I.A.S, the collector and district magistrate of Vijayawada, and Sri Malladi Vishnuvardhan Rao Garu, the vice chairman of the AP State Planning Commission. Other notable figures in attendance were Sri Vellampalli Srinivasa Rao Garu, the Hon'ble MLA of Vijayawada West, Smt. Badiginchal Vijayalakshmi Garu, the Hon'ble Chairperson of APHDCL, Smt. Shrivas Nupur Ajay Kumar Garu I.A.S, the Vijayawada District Joint Collector, and Sri Vishwa.M Garu, the Executive Director of APHDCL.

The Craft Bazaar features works from 110 artisans, showcasing the impressive craftsmanship and cultural diversity of Andhra Pradesh. Visitors can expect to see a variety of handicrafts such as Kondapalli and Etikoppaka Toys, wood carvings, rosewood articles, Udayagiri cutlery wooden items, Kalamkari paintings, Durgi Stone Carving, Kashmiri Shawls & Suits, coconut shell crafts, crochet lace, bobbin lace, pearls, imitation jewelry, leather items, Jute works, Leather Puppets, Madanapalli Terracotta, blue pottery, readymade items, Tanjore paintings, Rudraksha and Puja Items, and Eluru carpets, among many others.

The Craft Bazaar is open every day from 11:00 am to 9:00 pm, providing ample opportunity for visitors to experience and appreciate the exceptional talents of the artisans on display.

title: Lepakshi Gandhi Shilp Bazaar, Vishakapatnam
excerpt: Special Gandhi Jayanti celebration with a dedicated bazaar showcasing khadi and handloom products.
content:
The Lepakshi Gandhi Shilp Bazaar was held from March 23rd to May 1st, 2023, at the Shilparamam in Madhurawada, Visakhapatnam, organized by the Andhra Pradesh Handicrafts Development Corporation Limited. The craft bazaar featured over 100 stalls exhibiting the incredible craftsmanship and cultural diversity of India. The exhibition was inaugurated by Shri. K.S. Vishwanathan Garu, IAS, Joint Collector & District Magistrate, Visakhapatnam, along with other dignitaries, including Smt. Badiginchal Vijayalakshmi Garu, Honorable Chairperson of Andhra Pradesh Handicrafts Development Corporation Limited, and Sri. Vishwa.M Executive Director of APHDCL.

The craft bazaar provided a platform for artisans and craftsmen to showcase their skills and talents, and it featured a diverse range of handmade products such as embroidery fabrics, glass jewelry, hand-printed textiles, Jute crafts, lace dress material, toys from Kondapalli, terracotta potteries, bamboo craft, hand-printed bed sheets, dress materials, woodworks, and more. Smt. R.K. Roja Garu, Honorable Minister for Tourism, Culture, and Youth Advancement of Andhra Pradesh, also visited the exhibition.
